  3bitr3g(w0, wcel(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), ccnv(c0)), wcel(cop(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3)))), wbr(cv(hs0), ccnv(c0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), cv(hs1)))
  bitr4d(w0, wbr(cv(hs0), ccnv(c0), cv(hs1)), wbr(cv(hs0), crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))), cv(hs1)), wrex(s0, c1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))))
  3bitr4g(w0, wbr(cv(hs0), ccnv(c0), cv(hs1)), wrex(s0, c1, wa(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))), wbr(cv(hs1), c0, cv(hs0)), wrex(s0, c1, wa(wceq(cv(hs1), c3), wceq(cv(hs0), c2))))

  ancom(wceq(cv(hs0), c2), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))

thm fliftcnv(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

thm fliftfun(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí(Fun(c0)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c3 ‚Üí c4 = c5)))))
  ‚ä£ c0 = ran((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ < c2, c4 >))
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c2 ‚àà c6)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c4 ‚àà c7)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí c2 = c3)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí c4 = c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c7)

} = {
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(Fun(c0)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c3 ‚Üí c4 = c5))))), d(s1, c6))
  a1ii((w0 ‚Üí(Fun(c0)‚Üî ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c3 ‚Üí c4 = c5))))), d(s1, c7))
  impbid(w0, Fun(c0), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c3 ‚Üí c4 = c5))))
  ralrimd(s0, c1, w0, Fun(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c3 ‚Üí c4 = c5)))
  nfv(s0, w0)
  nffun(s0, c0)
  nfcxfr(s0, c0, ran((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ < c2, c4 >)))
  nfrn(s0, (s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ < c2, c4 >))
  nfmpt1(s0, c1, < c2, c4 >)

blocks.name: fliftfund
blocks.content: The function ` F ` is the unique function defined by ` F `` A = B ` , provided that the well-definedness condition holds. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2016.)

thm fliftfund(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wfun(c0))
  -| wceq(c0, crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(c2, c3))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c2, c4))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1)), wcel(c3, c5))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c2, c6))
  -| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wceq(c3, c7))
  -| wi(wa(w0, w3a(wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wceq(c2, c6))), wceq(c3, c7))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s0, c5)
  -| diffsc(s0, c6)
  -| diffsc(s0, c7)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c5)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, wfun(c0), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wi(wceq(c2, c6), wceq(c3, c7)))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c1, c1, w0, wi(wceq(c2, c6), wceq(c3, c7)))
  imp32(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wi(wceq(c2, c6), wceq(c3, c7)))
  3exp2(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(cv(s1), c1), wceq(c2, c6), wceq(c3, c7))
  fliftfun(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c6, c3, c7, c4, c5, w0)
}

thm fliftfund(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6, class c7, wff w0) {
  ‚ä¢ (w0 ‚Üí Fun(c0))
  ‚ä£ c0 = ran((s0 ‚àà c1 ‚Ü¶ < c2, c3 >))
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c2 ‚àà c4)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß s0 ‚àà c1)‚Üí c3 ‚àà c5)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí c2 = c6)
  ‚ä£ (s0 = s1 ‚Üí c3 = c7)
  ‚ä£ ((w0 ‚àß(s0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß s1 ‚àà c1 ‚àß c2 = c6))‚Üí c3 = c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c6)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c7)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c1)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c4)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c5)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, w0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, w0)
} = {
  mpbird(w0, Fun(c0), ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà c1, ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c1,(c2 = c6 ‚Üí c3 = c7))))
  ralrimivva(s0, s1, c1, c1, w0, (c2 = c6 ‚Üí c3 = c7))
  imp32(w0, s0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1, (c2 = c6 ‚Üí c3 = c7))
  3exp2(w0, s0 ‚àà c1, s1 ‚àà c1, c2 = c6, c3 = c7)
  fliftfun(s0, s1, c0, c1, c2, c6, c3, c7, c4, c5, w0)
}

thm fliftfuns(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, wff w0) {

  -| wceq(c0, crn(cmpt(s2, c1, cop(c2, c3))))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c1)), wcel(c2, c4))
  -| wi(wa(w0, wcel(cv(s2), c1)), wcel(c3, c5))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)

  -| diffss(s1, s2)

  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)

} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wb(wfun(c0), wral(s0, c1, wral(s1, c1, wi(wceq(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s1), c2)), wceq(csb(s2, cv(s0), c3), csb(s2, cv(s1), c3))))))), diffsc(s0, c0))
  fliftfun(s0, s1, c0, c1, csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s1), c2), csb(s2, cv(s0), c3), csb(s2, cv(s1), c3), c4, c5, w0)
  eqtri(c0, crn(cmpt(s0, c1, cop(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s0), c3)))), crn(cmpt(s2, c1, cop(c2, c3))))
  rneqi(cmpt(s2, c1, cop(c2, c3)), cmpt(s0, c1, cop(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s0), c3))))
  cbvmpt(s2, s0, c1, cop(c2, c3), cop(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s0), c3)))

  opeq12d(c2, c3, csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), csb(s2, cv(s0), c3), wceq(cv(s2), cv(s0)))
  mpan9(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), c4), wral(s2, c1, wcel(c2, c4)))
  ralrimiva(s2, c1, w0, wcel(c2, c4))
  rspc(s2, cv(s0), c1, wcel(c2, c4), wcel(csb(s2, cv(s0), c2), c4))

  mpan9(w0, wcel(cv(s0), c1), wcel(csb(s2, cv(s0), c3), c5), wral(s2, c1, wcel(c3, c5)))

  bibi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c5), wbr(cv(hs0), c1, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))), wbr(c5, c1, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, c5), c2, cfv(c0, cv(hs1))))

thm isorel(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5, class c6) {
  ‚ä¢ (((c0 ‚âÖ c1, c2(c3, c4))‚àß(c5 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c6 ‚àà c3))‚Üí(c5[c1]c6 ‚Üî(c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` c6)))
} = {
  mpan9((c0 ‚âÖ c1, c2(c3, c4)), (c5 ‚àà c3 ‚àß c6 ‚àà c3), (c5[c1]c6 ‚Üî(c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` c6)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c3, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c3,(hs0[c1]hs1 ‚Üî(c0 ` hs0)[c2](c0 ` hs1)))))
  simprbi((c0 ‚âÖ c1, c2(c3, c4)), ‚àÄ(hs0 ‚àà c3, ‚àÄ(hs1 ‚àà c3,(hs0[c1]hs1 ‚Üî(c0 ` hs0)[c2](c0 ` hs1)))), (c0 : c3 ‚Üî c4))
  df-isom(hs0, hs1, c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  rspc2v(hs0, hs1, c5, c3, c6, c3, (hs0[c1]hs1 ‚Üî(c0 ` hs0)[c2](c0 ` hs1)), (c5[c1]c6 ‚Üî(c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` c6)), (c5[c1]hs1 ‚Üî(c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` hs1)))
  bibi12d(hs0 = c5, hs0[c1]hs1, (c0 ` hs0)[c2](c0 ` hs1), c5[c1]hs1, (c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` hs1))
  breq1(hs0, c5, c1, hs1)
  breq1d((c0 ` hs0), c2, (c0 ` hs1), (c0 ` c5), hs0 = c5)
  fveq2(hs0, c5, c0)
  bibi12d(hs1 = c6, c5[c1]hs1, (c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` hs1), c5[c1]c6, (c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` c6))
  breq2(hs1, c6, c5, c1)
  breq2d((c0 ` c5), c2, (c0 ` hs1), (c0 ` c6), hs1 = c6)
  fveq2(hs1, c6, c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)

  diff.hs0.c(c2)

  diff.hs1.c(c5)

  diff.hs1.w((c5[c1]c6 ‚Üî(c0 ` c5)[c2](c0 ` c6)))
}

blocks.name: soisores
blocks.content: Express the condition of isomorphism on two strict orders for a function's restriction. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 22-Jan-2015.)

blocks.content: Infer isomorphism from one direction of an order proof for isomorphisms between strict orders. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: isomin
blocks.content: Isomorphisms preserve minimal elements. Note that ` ( ``' R " { D } ) ` is Takeuti and Zaring's idiom for the initial segment ` { x | x R D } ` . Proposition 6.31(1) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 19-Apr-2004.)

blocks.name: isoso
blocks.content: An isomorphism preserves strict ordering. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 16-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: isowe
blocks.content: An isomorphism preserves well-ordering. Proposition 6.32(3) of [TakeutiZaring] p. 33. (Contributed by NM, 30-Apr-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: isowe2
blocks.content: A weak form of ~ isowe that does not need Replacement. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 18-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm isowe2(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wi(wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3)))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wi(wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3))), diffsc(s0, c1))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wi(wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3))), diffsc(s0, c2))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wi(wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3))), diffsc(s0, c3))
  a1ii(wi(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wi(wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3))), diffsc(s0, c4))
  3imtr4g(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wwe(c2, c4), wwe(c1, c3), wa(wfr(c2, c4), wor(c2, c4)), wa(wfr(c1, c3), wor(c1, c3)))
  anim12d(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))), wfr(c2, c4), wor(c2, c4), wfr(c1, c3), wor(c1, c3))
  isofrlem(hs0, c2, c4, c1, c3, c0, wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))))
  simpl(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe)))
  adantl(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe)), wcel(cima(c0, cv(hs0)), universe))
  spv(s0, hs0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe), wcel(cima(c0, cv(hs0)), universe))
  eleq1d(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe, cima(c0, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  imaeq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  adantr(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe)), wi(wor(c2, c4), wor(c1, c3)))
  isosolem(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4)
  df-we(c2, c4)
  df-we(c1, c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c2)
  diff.hs0.c(c4)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.c(c3)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wiso(c0, c1, c2, c3, c4), wal(s0, wcel(cima(c0, cv(s0)), universe))))
  diff.wcel.s(s0, cima(c0, cv(hs0)), universe)
  diff.cima.s(s0, c0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.universe.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: f1oiso2
blocks.content: Any one-to-one onto function determines an isomorphism with an induced relation ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.)

blocks.name: f1owe

thm f1owe(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4) {
  |- wi(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wi(wwe(c3, c2), wwe(c4, c1)))

  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c3)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
} = {
  biimprd(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wwe(c3, c2), wwe(c4, c1))
  mpan2(wf1o(c0, c1, c2), wb(wwe(c4, c1), wwe(c3, c2)), wral(hs0, c1, wral(hs1, c1, wb(wbr(cv(hs0), c4, cv(hs1)), wbr(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(hs1)))))))

  breq1d(cfv(c0, cv(s0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), wceq(cv(s0), cv(hs0)))
  fveq2(cv(s0), cv(hs0), c0)
  breq2d(cfv(c0, cv(hs0)), c3, cfv(c0, cv(s1)), cfv(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(s1), cv(hs1)))
  fveq2(cv(s1), cv(hs1), c0)

blocks.name: knatar
blocks.content: The Knaster-Tarski theorem says that every monotone function over a complete lattice has a (least) fixpoint. Here we specialize this theorem to the case when the lattice is the powerset lattice ` ~P A ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà c1 ‚àß(c2 ` c0)‚äÜ c0 ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0 ‚àà P(c0), ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà P(s0),(c2 ` s1)‚äÜ(c2 ` s0))))‚Üí(c3 ‚äÜ c0 ‚àß(c2 ` c3)= c3))
  ‚ä£ c3 = ‚ãÇ { s2 ‚àà P(c0)|(c2 ` s2)‚äÜ s2 }
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c2)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c3)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s2, c2)
} = {
